com.abmash.api.browser

Class JavaScript

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.abmash.api.browser.JavaScript

  • public class JavaScript
extends java.lang.Object
    Execute or evaluate custom JavaScript, used by calling Browser.javaScript(String, Object...).

    Executing a script returns either true if the result was non-false, or false if it was empty. Evaluating a script returns the return value of the script.

    JavaScript can be executed or evaluated synchronously or asynchronously. The parameter is optional and can be used to execute the script on a specific object instead of the whole document.

    • evaluate(Browser, Object...) evaluates the script synchronously
    • evaluateAsync(Browser, Object...) evaluates the script asynchronously

    Author:
    Alper Ortac

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public JavaScriptResult evaluate(Browser browser,
                        java.lang.Object... args)
        Evaluates JavaScript synchronously.
        Parameters:
        browser - Browser instance to work with
        args - optional list of objects which are passed to the script as arguments, accessable with arguments[0] etc.
        Returns:
        returned value of executed script

      • evaluateAsync

        public JavaScriptResult evaluateAsync(Browser browser,
                             java.lang.Object... args)
        Evaluates JavaScript asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        browser - Browser instance to work with
        args - optional list of objects which are passed to the script as arguments, accessable with arguments[0] etc.
        Returns:
        returned value of executed script
